    Let's Talk

November 23, 2024

Moving Over to 11ty from Jekyll

I've been using Jekyll to make websites for a few years now but today something finally happened that made me move my site over to 11ty.

Why I Like Jekyll

The main reason I like Jekyll is because it's easy to use and provides you with a lot of powerful tools. I mainly used it for SEO projects and smaller landing page websites I'd send paid ads too.

Jekyll's Limitation

My only complain about Jekyll is the build time.

What Happened That Made Me Switch

Earlier this week when I was building out this website I found myself having to wait longer and longer for my code to compile. At first it wasn't a big deal but the more code I added the longer my computer would freeze. It got to the point where it just wasn't avoidable and I quickly began looking into alternatives.

The reason I'd never ran into this issues before is because most of the projects I've made up until now have been relatively small. It really wasn't until I started working on this website that it became a problem.

Why I Chose Eleventy

While it has been a bit of a headache adapting to this new static site generator it has gone relatively well and I'm quite surprised by the speed and features.

I chose 11ty for a few reasons but the main one is for it's speed.

From what I've read online it seems that Jekyll is built using older technology. Compare that to 11ty that's built with JavaScript and builds website almost instantaneously.
